title: AM0-AB102-ARCHIVES
description: This project will develop a state of the art Archives Building to hold historical records and materials.  This project  will include storage for additional historical records that will be transferred to the Archives for the next 30 years.  This project will provide the District with an Archives Building comparable to state archives in managing their historical records. The records stored in the new Archives Building will include those of such notables as President George Washington, Robert Brent,the First Mayor of the City of Washington, Frederick Douglass, Woodrow Wilson and others.  Also, the records holdings of the District of Columbia Records Center include marriage and probate records from 1801; birth and death records beginning with the Territorial Government; Engineering Development records from the Board of Commission created under the Organic Act of 1878; and other records.
justification: The District of Columbia Archives holds historical and permanently valuable records of the DC Government such as birth and death records, wills, land records and marriage records.
progress_assessment: The archival material inventory is underway, and will help in developing requirements for the design of the new facility.
